channel.title: Count the following!
channel.description:
I would like everyone to take a look at the following sentence and post a reply saying how many F's there are in the sentence:
[hr] FINISHED FILES ARE THE RE SULT OF YEARS OF SCIENTI FIC STUDY COMBINED WITH THE EXPERIENCE OF YEARS. [hr]
This is not a trick in any way.

item.title: Count the following!
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Krim, post:13, topic:445673”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=548510.msg4020857#msg4020857 date=1340000831]

I starred straight at the “OF”'s and didn’t even count them… Lol.

The average brain is incapable of processing the word “of” without directly putting your conscious towards it.

@ eyeownyew - I was checking to see if anyone was able to legitimately count the total number of F’s, which in fact determines if someone is a genius or not – without the use of notepad++ of course .

Eh? It actually determines if someone is a genius? Odd
[/quote]
Yes, people that are considered ‘geniuses’ are able to access a greater amount of their brains, when commonly only up to 20% is accessed by humans.[/quote]

This isn’t true and there is absolutely no proof

We use our whole brain. I did like that movie though

Read full topic

item.title: Count the following!
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Krim, post:21, topic:445673”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=548510.msg4020884#msg4020884 date=1340002709]

I kinda cheated read replies first then did it x]. You can’t define being a ‘genius’ by this lawl. By whose standards is this a genius? Maybe in 50 years time this will be child play. Also, their are different aspects of being a ‘genius’ i.e. wisdom, you may not know a lot but the way you use your knowledge can make you into a ‘genius’.
Just saying, don’t use the term genius so loosely.

I understand that, but unless our brain activity magically increases in 50 years, there will be no change in the way we interpret some things that are caused due to brain related matters. The term genius has been debated for many years, because there is no official definition of it. I do include that someone may be considered a genius by detecting the six F’s, but that is only one aspect of many that the term ‘genius’ appears to exhibit.

We can modify our bodies currently correct? Did you know we can modify our brains too? Just currently its not perfected etc. Atm its very crude technology, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4jol-9mB9ZU So many things like this but none ready for the general public. Maybe things like this will be ready in 50 years tbh. Oh and btw the human race is only getting smarter, compare us to 50 years ago we know so much more.

Their is a meaning for it [quote]a genius is someone embodying exceptional intellectual ability, creativity, or originality, typically to a degree that is associated with the achievement of unprecedented insight.[/quote] (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genius)
You mean that nobody can properly define the word… But a ‘genius’ can exhibit stupidity just like anyone else, in my opinion their are no ‘geniuses’ just some very fucking smart people haha. When we get to the genius stage of my life in my opinion we’ll be able to do things that seem crazy to us. Atm we’re very dumb in the grand scheme of things, compare us to simple evolution;o.
[/quote]
Yes.[/quote]
Your using your grammar wrong, you can’t just say yes to that lol. It doesn’t make sense, you can say I agree/disagree etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Count the following!
item.dc:creator: @Krim Krim
item.description:
@Krim wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:16, topic:445673”]I kinda cheated read replies first then did it x]. You can’t define being a ‘genius’ by this lawl. By whose standards is this a genius? Maybe in 50 years time this will be child play. Also, their are different aspects of being a ‘genius’ i.e. wisdom, you may not know a lot but the way you use your knowledge can make you into a ‘genius’.
Just saying, don’t use the term genius so loosely.[/quote]
I understand that, but unless our brain activity magically increases in 50 years, there will be no change in the way we interpret some things that are caused due to brain related matters. The term genius has been debated for many years, because there is no official definition of it. I do include that someone may be considered a genius by detecting the six F’s, but that is only one aspect of many that the term ‘genius’ appears to exhibit.

I understand that a person’s IQ doesn’t mean anything when it comes to intelligence, however this brings us back to the brain activity of a person. I’m no guru at the study of the brain, nor the entire body for that matter, but I can strongly say that the amount of access a person has to their brain affects the output of every single action a person executes.

Read full topic

item.title: Count the following!
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:17, topic:445673”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=548510.msg4020869#msg4020869 date=1340001679]
I kinda cheated read replies first then did it x]. You can’t define being a ‘genius’ by this lawl. By whose standards is this a genius? Maybe in 50 years time this will be child play. Also, their are different aspects of being a ‘genius’ i.e. wisdom, you may not know a lot but the way you use your knowledge can make you into a ‘genius’.
Just saying, don’t use the term genius so loosely.
[/quote]
Brains can also be applied in different areas. Just because someone has an IQ of 150 doesn’t mean they are smart – they may be ‘mentally retarded’ when it comes to previously learned knowledge, but they could learn quickly.
Brains are odd.[/quote]
Exactly my point, just didn’t want to go into too much depth as I’m lazy ;p.

Read full topic

item.title: Count the following!
item.dc:creator: @Krim Krim
item.description:
@Krim wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:12, topic:445673”][quote author=Krim link=topic=548510.msg4020841#msg4020841 date=1339999922]

I starred straight at the “OF”'s and didn’t even count them… Lol.

The average brain is incapable of processing the word “of” without directly putting your conscious towards it.

@ eyeownyew - I was checking to see if anyone was able to legitimately count the total number of F’s, which in fact determines if someone is a genius or not – without the use of notepad++ of course .
[/quote]
Eh? It actually determines if someone is a genius? Odd :|[/quote]
Yes, people that are considered ‘geniuses’ are able to access a greater amount of their brains, when commonly only up to 20% is accessed by humans. The movie ‘Limitless’ shows the effects that occur once a guy uses a medicinal method of increasing brain activity, which doesn’t increase your intelligence, but improves the concentration a human can have. We all are able to possess the same knowledge, but the problem is how we can go about obtaining that knowledge.

Here is another cool thing to try:

Say the phrase ‘toy boat’ three times in rapid succession.

Read full topic
